wikipedia_page.main: William Crisp Rose (1 December 1861 – 2 February 1937) was an English international footballer who played as a goalkeeper.

response: *William Rose (MP for Canterbury) (before 1410–after 1443), MP for Canterbury
*William Rose (schoolmaster and writer) (1719–1786), Scottish schoolmaster and classical scholar
*Axl Rose (William Rose, born 1962), Guns N' Roses vocalist
*Sir William Rose, 2nd Baronet (1846–1902), owner in Victorian times of Moor Park, Farnham
* 4 March – William Rose (d. 1937), England international goalkeeper in five matches (1884–1891).

Immediately establishing himself as the first choice goalkeeper, he played 66 games in his two and half years with the club. He even scored a goal, being one of the scorers in a 12–0 route of Ironbridge in the final of the 1885 Burslem Challenge Cup. He was called up to the England national team for the match against Ireland in 1886, to act as William Rose's reserve.
